titleStmt.title: An emblem of mortality. Containing a dialogue between a prince and pale-fac'd death. Wherein it appears, that no person, from the highest to the lowest, can be free from his severe stroke, though never to loath so leave the glory of the tempting world ; yet it is evident that we must whenevery death shall call.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A. M. for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball near the Bear Tavern in Py-Corner,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Publisher's advertisements at foot of page.
Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.

place.placeName: the Golden Ball near the Bear Tavern in Py-Corner
